abstract: Comcast said that instead of interfering with specific online applications, it will manage traffic by slowing the Internet speeds of its most bandwidth-hogging users when traffic is busiest.
snippet: Comcast said that instead of interfering with specific online applications, it will manage traffic by slowing the Internet speeds of its most bandwidth-hogging users when traffic is busiest.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Comcast, the country’s largest residential Internet provider, said on Thursday that it would take a more equitable approach toward managing the ever-expanding flow of Web traffic on its network.

headline.main: Comcast Adjusts Way It Manages Internet Traffic
headline.print_headline: Comcast Altering Its Method of Managing Web Traffic
